args:
Learning the head butler was possessed by a
ghost, the party rushes to the basement thinking
the same fate may have befallen Emile. When
they discover him surrounded by spirits and
muttering to himself, they employ force in an
attempt to return the emperor to his senses.
If this technique works on him,\nthat means...
BYE BYE TO MY FRIEND'S BOOOODY!
Oh my gosh, a ghost just came\nflying out of the head butler!
He's awakened.\n...Do you recall what happened to you?
As I recall, Emperor Emile was\nendeavoring at his studies, so I went\nto the basement to check on him.
I saw him there, but then...\nNo. The rest is a haze.
I sense no deception on his part,\nand the mana flowing from him is pure.
Meaning it is as we thought?
Yes. He was under the control\nof a spirit this entire time.
Tell us something, if you will:\nWhat is Emile doing in the basement?
And I would like to know exactly what is\nhappening in the manor, so perhaps we\nshould exchange information.
...So Emperor Emile is chanting a spell in\nthe basement that is summoning spirits.
Meaning I was likely possessed when I\nwent down there to check on him.
Did you never wonder why Emile had\nchosen to shut himself away down there?
He has never been one to get lost in books\nor study. It is completely unlike him.
I had never met the Emperor prior to\nserving at his manor, and am as yet not\nintimately familiar with his manner.
I simply thought the man was given\nto self-improvement.
This is a fine trait, so I swore to do my\nutmost to support him and ensure none\ndisturbed his pursuits.
So all those auditions you made us do\nwere actually to help Emile?
Just so. I could hardly trust anything less\nthan first-rate servants with seeing to my\nmaster's precious time.

I personally found it quite worthwhile to
support Emperor Emile from morning to
night, and I needed to ensure others
felt the same.
I can appreciate such devotion;\nyour affection for the man is clear.
Meaning your overprotectiveness\nstemmed from before you were possessed.
That said, I would never plunge applicants\ninto an abyss no matter how strict my\nevaluations were to become!
I must have already been possessed\nby that point.

And now that I think on it, I remember
seeking out excellent applicants who
might be willing to attend a party...
Oh, but this is all so shameful!
Don't be sad! It's not your fault!
Regardless, it's clear now that whatever's\nin the basement is SUPER dangerous.
Agreed. The possibility is exceedingly high\nthat whatever possessed the head butler\nis the same thing afflicting Emile.
Then we must hurry to the basement.
I will accompany you. As the head butler\nof this household, it is my duty to see to\nEmperor Emile until the end.
Yet spirits still crowd the area.\nFor example...
If you come with us, you may end up\npossessed once more. You should wait\nhere for your own sake.

Not to worry! My previous blunder came
about because I was caught unawares
but now I am prepared with my servant
technique!
Don't tell me you're going to use that\nskill too!
Here I go. Intermediate servants' technique!\n...HAH!
NOOOOOOOO! WHAT A WORLD,\nWHAT A WORLD...
Wha? What happened to saying Adorbs\nDevotion Beam?
Perhaps we could have just shouted\nanything?
No, performing that skill without its\nincantation is only for experts. Normally,\nsaying the phrase is the best way.

I must say, this is the first time I have ever
seen it cast incantation-less. I suppose
it's true that there's always someone
better out there.
So the head butler is quite powerful, eh?\nVery well then. Let us all head for the\nbasement together.
*pant* *pant* *pant* Are you all right,\nEmperor Emile?! We have come to
There's a ton of ghosts here, but I don't\nsee Emile anywh... Oh!
He is surrounded by spirits, yet continues\nreading unhindered? This is most strange.
As the son of my dear friend Aurelius,\nI shall help you now.
It did not even phase him! He continues to\nchant the spell with single-minded focus!
The ghost that's controlling him must be\nforcing him to continue summoning ghosts!
Then we'll simply perform a direct\nexorcism as the head butler did earlier.
Forgive us if this gets rough, Emperor,\nbut we must free you!
Hang on, Emile! We got you!
